1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles V. Donnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles V. Donnell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles V. Donnell was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault-Contact w/Person under 16-Use/Threat of Force/Violence (Actor is 18) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Habitual Criminality], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
++ Pay DNA surcharge.  May Not have contact with victim.  Lifetime Sex Offender Registration.

records.addlTxt:
03:32 PM  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant is sentenced to WSP; 10 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 798 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered.  No contact w/ victim.  Lifetime sex offender registration ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

10:16 AM  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Amended information filed.  DE acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 1 is dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
This case continues to trail co-defendant's case (15CF1234).  STC scheduled for 7/19/2019 at 10am.  Parties notified in court.
This case continues to trail co-defendant's case (15CF1234).  3/1/2019 STC is rescheduled to 3/12/2019 at 10:30am.  Parties notified via email.

MINUTES:  Attorney Johnson is requesting an adjournment.  This case is trailing co-defendant's case (15CF1234).  Court grants request.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Parties are requesting 12/13/2018 STC be rescheduled - STC is rescheduled to 1/18/2019 at 10:30am.
Status conference on December 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.
